alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:44PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Haskell, southeastern Sequoyah and north central Le Flore Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 543 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southwest of Gans, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Muldrow... Gans... Cowlington... Cottonwood... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 306 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
